intro: Hieracium × johannis-jansenii, commonly known as the Jansen's hawkweed, is a hybrid plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers, typical of the daisy family. The plant typically grows in meadows and disturbed soils, exhibiting a creeping growth habit with rhizomes. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Due to its hybrid origin, it displays a variety of morphological traits that can vary depending on the parent species.
